title: Serif Companion for Trade Gothic Extended
content:
Hello All,

I’m working on some self-promotional print ads for an interactive agency. Their corporate typeface is Trade Gothic Extended (bold for their word-mark, headings, etc., and regular for shorter text). After a while, all Trade Gothic Extended starts to look boring.

Any recommendations for a complimentary serif face, that could be a good contrast to their corporate face (maybe as heading, or body copy?)

Thanks in advance,

Andrew

author: andrewh973

comments.content: Nearly anything will work with Trade Gothic. Tell us more about the corporation. What is their tone? What sort of work do they do? Who are their clients?

Stephen,

Thanks for your response. The agency does interactive work for pharmaceutical companies. They want to be perceived as “sophisticated and cutting-edge” by their existing and prospective clients. Their corporate colors: PMS 021 - orange, PMS 281 - blue.
